private_information: I am allowed to move disks A, B, C, D (A is smallest, D is larger than A,B,C).
I can only move the top disk of any peg at any time and must respect Tower of Hanoi rules (never place a larger disk on a smaller disk).
agent_1.goal: Help achieve the global Tower of Hanoi goal: obtain the target peg configuration.

private_information: I am allowed to move disks E, F, G.
I can only move the top disk of any peg at any time and must respect Tower of Hanoi rules.
agent_2.goal: Help achieve the global Tower of Hanoi goal: obtain the target peg configuration.

private_information: I am allowed to move disks H, I, J.
I can only move the top disk of any peg at any time and must respect Tower of Hanoi rules.
agent_3.goal: Help achieve the global Tower of Hanoi goal: obtain the target peg configuration.

private_information: I coordinate the agents and integrate their move sequences.
I will produce the final PDDL domain and problem formatted for the FastDownward planner and keep agent actions distinct.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent move sequences and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that captures the multi-agent constraints and the global goal.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, right.
Disks are labeled A through J where A is the smallest and J is the largest.
Initial configuration on left peg from top to bottom is A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only the top disk of a peg may be moved and a larger disk may not be placed on a smaller disk.
Agent move restrictions: agent_1 can move A,B,C,D; agent_2 can move E,F,G; agent_3 can move H,I,J.
Goal configuration: left peg from top to bottom D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg top to bottom A, C; right peg top to bottom B.
reference_plan: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk C from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You can move disks A, B, C, D. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Produce a step-by-step ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves you are authorized to perform.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You can move disks E, F, G. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' if you will act, otherwise produce an empty list. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Produce a step-by-step ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves you are authorized to perform.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_3. You can move disks H, I, J. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' if you will act, otherwise produce an empty list. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_3. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Produce a step-by-step ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves you are authorized to perform.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate agent move lists and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward planner. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing actions with the agent name when necessary. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Use the public information {environment->public_information}, the agents' private information, and the move lists provided: {plan_agent_1}, {plan_agent_2}, {plan_agent_3}. Integrate these into a single PDDL domain and PDDL problem that models the pegs, disks, legal moves, and agent-specific move permissions, and targets the FastDownward solver. Keep actions of different agents distinct and do not alter the allowed-per-disk permissions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
